alert.note: Alert for Blount; Knox; Loudon; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 05 at 4:52PM CDT until August 05 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Loudon County in east Tennessee... Southern Knox County in east Tennessee... Northern Blount County in east Tennessee... Central Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 552 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lenoir City to near Maryville to 11 miles southeast of Eagleton Village, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Maryville, Sevierville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Loudon, Farragut, Pigeon Forge, Louisville and Rockford. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 377 and 389, and between mile markers 405 and 407. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
